title: Suicide Risk Assessment Using Multimodal Speech Features: A Study on the SW1 Challenge Dataset
author: Ambre MARIE (LaTIM, UMR INSERM 1101), Ilias MAOUDJ (LaTIM, UMR INSERM 1101), Guillaume DARDENNE (INSERM), Gwenole QUELLEC (INSERM), ...
relevance_why: The study employs multimodal approaches for speech analysis, which can inform Haohe Liu's work in audio processing and machine learning applications, particularly in enhancing models for audio data interpretation.
background: This study focuses on assessing the risk of suicide in adolescents through analysis of their speech, utilizing various audio and text modalities.
contribution: This paper introduces a multimodal approach that combines linguistic and acoustic features to improve suicide risk assessment, achieving an accuracy of 69% on the development set.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional assessment methods primarily relied on clinical interviews or self-reports, often leading to biases and misclassification.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates deep learning techniques (e.g., WhisperX, RoBERTa, WavLM) with handcrafted acoustic features, utilizing a novel weighted attention mechanism for better feature fusion.

key_innovation: The incorporation of weighted attention allows the model to dynamically assess feature importance across different modalities, enhancing predictive ability.
real_world_impact: The approach offers a potential tool for clinicians to identify individuals at risk of suicide more effectively, thus promoting timely intervention measures.
limitations: The performance gap between development and test sets indicates possible overfitting and challenges in generalizing findings beyond the dataset.

new_terms.multimodal: **Multimodal** refers to the integration and analysis of multiple forms of data, such as text and audio, to enhance understanding and make predictions.
new_terms.acoustic features: **Acoustic features** are characteristics derived from audio signals, including pitch, tone, and modulation, which can indicate emotional or psychological states.
